root.name: Energy Czar
root.description: An economic and political simulation, Energy Czar puts the player in the seat of the United States' mini dictator in charge of fueling the U.S. economic machine. The term Energy Czar was relatively new, having been introduced during the Nixon administration less than a decade before. Other "czars" were brought in during various financial or political problems demanding consistent, expert leadership that a president couldn't manage. List of Some of the notable "czars" in U.S. history:Poverty Czar, Lyndon Johnson (1964)Drug Czar, Ronald Reagan (1982)Terrorism Czar, Bill Clinton (1998)War Czar, George W. Bush (2007)The term is not favored by all administrations, but it is meant to convey the strong authority they're given to tackle the specific problem they're assigned to address.
